text: you using coded or drag and drop <@U3TR96G84>
my template is often composed of a header, a content part with a flexible content in which I insert custom module like my hero banner
Why not use the menu and hubdb fields in the module?
I assume he isn't trying to reduplicate the code
i just want ot reuse a custom module like a breadcrumbs module in another one
Unfortunately, I don’t believe there is a way to do so currently.
any chance we can get a “description ‘field’” in the new design manager as an option when adding a field in a custom module

Here’s the use case:
I’m building a module that includes a Google Map using the javascript api. I have an api key field. I want to have descriptive text with a link in it linking the person to the generate API key page: ```<a href="https://console.developers.google.com/flows/enableapi?apiid=maps_backend,geocoding_backend,directions_backend,distance_matrix_backend,elevation_backend,places_backend&reusekey=true">Generate Google Maps Javascript API Key</a>```  but that’s not possible with help text.

New design manager request - number fields should allow any number of decimal places…

My previously mentioned map module now needs to use a text field instead of number filed for the lat long coordinates because it doesn’t let you enter a number longer than 6 characters(including decimal point)
Isnt there a locations field or is that just the hubdb?
no location field :disappointed: it would be awesome if one were added
